skill.name: datacommons-client
skill.description: Work with Data Commons, a platform providing programmatic access to public statistical data from global sources. Use this skill when working with demographic data, economic indicators, health statistics, environmental data, or any public datasets available through Data Commons. Applicable for querying population statistics, GDP figures, unemployment rates, disease prevalence, geographic entity resolution, and exploring relationships between statistical entities.
skill.summary: Work with Data Commons, a platform providing programmatic access to public statistical data from glo...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The repository contains documentation and example code for the Data Commons Python client. Examples demonstrate network calls to the Data Commons API and optional CSV export, but no executable scripts or hidden logic are present.

low_findings.title: Examples perform Data Commons API calls
low_findings.description: Example code initializes the client and calls the resolve endpoint: "client = DataCommonsClient()" and "client.resolve.fetch_dcids_by_name(...)". This implies network access to Data Commons APIs, which could transmit query inputs.

low_findings.title: Example writes results to local CSV
low_findings.description: The example exports a comparison table to disk: "comparison.to_csv('ca_cities_comparison.csv')". This writes data to the local filesystem and could store outputs if used as-is.

content.value_statement: Public statistics are scattered across many sources and formats. This skill provides a clear workflow to resolve places and query Data Commons data.
actual_capabilities: Resolve place names or coordinates to Data Commons DCIDs
Fetch latest or time series observations for statistical variables
Query hierarchies with relation expressions for places
List available statistical variables for an entity
Retrieve entity names and property labels from the graph
limitations: Requires an API key for datacommons.org access
Resolve endpoint supports place entities only
Data availability varies by source and facet
Examples require the Data Commons Python client installed

use_cases.title: Compare state metrics
use_cases.description: Compare population, income, and unemployment across states using consistent facets.

use_cases.title: Build time series
use_cases.description: Retrieve historical series for one variable and prepare it for analysis.

use_cases.title: Check data coverage
use_cases.description: See which statistical variables are available for target regions.

prompt_templates.title: Get latest population
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner query for a few places
prompt_templates.prompt: Resolve California and Texas to DCIDs and fetch the latest Count_Person values.

prompt_templates.title: List available variables
prompt_templates.prompt: List available statistical variables for geoId/06 and summarize the top 10 by name.

prompt_templates.title: Query county hierarchy
prompt_templates.prompt: Fetch 2020 Median_Income_Household for all counties in California using a relation expression.

prompt_templates.title: Compare time series
prompt_templates.prompt: Get UnemploymentRate_Person time series for USA and Canada and describe key trend differences.

output_examples.input: Show the latest population for California and Texas.
output: Sources: Data Commons facets from census.gov

best_practices: Resolve place names to DCIDs before querying observations
Use filter_facet_domains to keep data sources consistent
Check available variables before large queries
anti_patterns: Querying without resolving ambiguous place names
Requesting all dates when only the latest value is needed
Mixing facets from different sources without noting provenance

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes. The prompts and workflows are compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: Limits depend on the Data Commons API and the availability of facets for each entity.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with pandas?
faq.answer: Yes. Observation responses can be converted to pandas records for analysis.

faq.question: Does it access local files or secrets?
faq.answer: The skill documentation does not access local files or credentials by itself.

faq.question: What if a query returns no data?
faq.answer: Check available variables, confirm dates, and verify the entity DCIDs.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual API calls?
faq.answer: It provides clear workflows and examples while using the official Python client.
